Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or data to support the statement that services constitute 60% of the economy. Without sufficient supporting information, it is difficult to determine the accuracy of the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the structure of the economy is such that services constitute 60% of it. However, this assumption may not hold true for all countries or regions, as economic structures can vary significantly.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the composition of the economy, such as the contribution of other sectors like agriculture or manufacturing. Without considering these alternative explanations, the claim may present an incomplete or biased view of the economy.
